title: A reprint of an old typebook reviewed at CreativePro today
content:
dot-font: Where Type Came From   
One of the clearest, most informative books about early typography is back in print.   
   
(creativepro.com)   
By John D. Berry ,creativepro.com contributing editor   
Monday, October 20, 2003
author: dgweaver53m

comments.content:
why not post this in the news section, or at least provide a direct link to the article in question?   
   
 [http://www.creativepro.com/story/feature/20316.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141052/http:/www.creativepro.com/story/feature/20316.html)
Very good book, but the quality of the reproductions in the new edition leave something to be desired when compared with the original.

\>an ad for "Hairclub for Men."   
   
In that case I will avoid it, and remain fashionably bald.
